snippet: A defense paper released Tuesday said Washington’s  effort to strengthen its military presence in Asia and cement ties with allies was a threat to China.
abstract: China publishes national defense paper suggesting that United States is creating tensions in Asia-Pacific region by strengthening its military presence and reinforcing its alliances there.

byline.original: By JANE PERLEZ and CHRIS BUCKLEY
byline.contributor: Jane Perlez reported from Haikou, and Chris Buckley from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: A defense paper released Tuesday said Washington’s  effort to strengthen its military presence in Asia and cement ties with allies was a threat to China.

headline.seo: China Suggests U.S. Is Stirring Tensions in Asia
headline.main: China Suggests That U.S., Projecting Power, Is Stirring Asia-Pacific Tensions
headline.print_headline: China Suggests That U.S., Projecting Power, Is Stirring Asia-Pacific Tensions

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations
